title: Mark Gaffney on 911
content:
Looking at other aspects of 911 events: the money factor and Flight 93 crash in Shanksville PA Mark Gaffney is a... <!--more--> researcher, environmentalist, author and peace activist.
His first book was a pioneering study about the Israeli nuclear weapons program.
He has worked with such organizations as the National Audubon Society, Greenpeace, and No More Chernobyls in Washington.
In addition to Mark’s works of poetry and religious studies, he is also an independent researcher and investigator into events concerning 911.
He is the author of “The 911 Mystery Plane and The Vanishing of America” which investigates the presence of the world’s most advanced military and control plane, the E4-B, on the scenes of 911.
His most recent book is “Black 911: Money, Motive, and Technology,” with a forward by Consensus 911 panelist member Aidan Monaghan, which tackles the questions of financial activities before and after 911, the events surrounding the questionable crash of UAL 93 in Shanksville, PA and other topics.
